title.value: Enhancing Protein Language Model with Structure-Based Encoder and Pre-Training
title.justification: The title is explicitly mentioned at the beginning of the research paper.
title.quote: E NHANCING P ROTEIN L ANGUAGE M ODEL WITH S TRUCTURE - BASED E NCODER AND P RE - TRAINING

extractions.description: This paper proposes an enhancement of protein language models (PLMs) by integrating a structure-based encoder and pre-training. The enhanced model, called ESM-GearNet, combines ESM-1b and GearNet, and leverages contrastive learning for pre-training on unlabeled protein structures to improve protein function prediction tasks.

type.justification: The paper conducts extensive experiments and empirical evaluations on EC and GO protein function prediction benchmarks to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed model.
type.quote: Extensive experiments on EC and GO protein function prediction benchmarks demonstrate the superiority of ESM-GearNet over previous PLMs and structure encoders.

name.justification: The research focuses on enhancing protein language models (PLMs), which falls under the domain of Natural Language Processing.
name.quote: Regarding protein sequences as the language of life, PLMs aim to learn effective protein representations from large-scale protein sequence corpora.

name.justification: The paper deals with protein structures and function prediction, which is a key area of computational biology.
name.quote: Machine learning methods have shown great promise in predicting protein structures and understanding protein functions.

name.justification: The study involves learning effective protein representations using pre-trained language models and structure-based encoders.
name.quote: PLMs have shown impressive performance on predicting protein structures and functionality.

name.justification: The primary model proposed and evaluated in this paper is ESM-GearNet.
name.quote: We empirically verify the ESM-GearNet that connects two encoders in a series way as the most effective combination model.

is_contributed.justification: ESM-GearNet is the primary contribution of this paper, integrating ESM-1b and GearNet with pre-training strategies.
is_contributed.quote: In this work, we enhance the PLM with structure-based encoder and pre-training.

is_executed.justification: The model was executed on GPUs for training and evaluation purposes.
is_executed.quote: All these models are implemented with TorchDrug library and trained on 4 Tesla A100 GPUs.

is_compared.justification: ESM-GearNet was compared with other baseline models in various experiments.
is_compared.quote: The benchmark results verify the superiority of the proposed ESM-GearNet over vanilla PLMs, various protein structure encoders and existing structure encoder enhanced PLMs.

referenced_paper_title.value: Biological structure and function emerge from scaling unsupervised learning to 250 million protein sequences.
referenced_paper_title.justification: ESM-1b, which is part of the ESM-GearNet model, references Rives et al., 2021.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We choose ESM-1b (Rives et al., 2021) as our baseline backbone model.

name.justification: The AlphaFold Database is used for pre-training the ESM-GearNet model.
name.quote: We follow (Zhang et al., 2022b) to use the AlphaFold protein structure database v1 and v2 (Varadi et al., 2021) for pre-training.

referenced_paper_title.value: AlphaFold protein structure database: massively expanding the structural coverage of protein-sequence space with high-accuracy models.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for AlphaFold Database is by Varadi et al., 2021.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We follow (Zhang et al., 2022b) to use the AlphaFold protein structure database v1 and v2 (Varadi et al., 2021) for pre-training.

name.justification: The Protein Data Bank (PDB) is mentioned as a source of abundant unlabeled structures.
name.quote: These methods only focus on a limited number of labeled structures, while ignoring abundant unlabeled structures available in PDB (Berman et al., 2000).

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for PDB is by Berman et al., 2000.
referenced_paper_title.quote: These methods only focus on a limited number of labeled structures, while ignoring abundant unlabeled structures available in PDB (Berman et al., 2000).

name.justification: The Swiss-Prot dataset was used for pre-training in conjunction with the AlphaFold database.
name.quote: We follow (Zhang et al., 2022b) to use ... 440K Swiss-Prot (Consortium, 2021) predictions from AlphaFold2.

referenced_paper_title.value: UniProt: the universal protein knowledgebase in 2021.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for Swiss-Prot is by the UniProt Consortium, 2021.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We follow (Zhang et al., 2022b) to use ... 440K Swiss-Prot (Consortium, 2021) predictions from AlphaFold2.

name.justification: GO is used as a benchmark for evaluating the performance of the proposed model.
name.quote: We run experiments on EC and GO protein function prediction benchmarks.

referenced_paper_title.value: A large-scale evaluation of computational protein function prediction.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for Gene Ontology is by Radivojac et al., 2013.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We report the protein-centric maximum F-score Fmax and pair-centric area under precision-recall curve AUPR, which are commonly used in the CAFA challenges (Radivojac et al., 2013).

name.justification: EC is used as a benchmark for evaluating the performance of the proposed model.
name.quote: We run experiments on EC and GO protein function prediction benchmarks.

referenced_paper_title.value: Structure-based protein function prediction using graph convolutional networks.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for Enzyme Commission is by GligorijeviÄ‡ et al., 2021.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Enzyme Commission (EC) number prediction predicts the EC numbers of proteins, characterizing biochemical reactions they catalyze.

name.justification: This deep learning library was used to implement the models mentioned in the paper.
name.quote: All these models are implemented with TorchDrug library (Zhu et al., 2022) and trained on 4 Tesla A100 GPUs.

referenced_paper_title.value: TorchDrug: A powerful and flexible machine learning platform for drug discovery.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for TorchDrug is by Zhu et al., 2022.
referenced_paper_title.quote: All these models are implemented with TorchDrug library (Zhu et al., 2022) and trained on 4 Tesla A100 GPUs.
